questions.question: What is the intrinsic reaction coordinate (IRC)?

answers.a: It is the steepest descent path path from a transition state connecting to the corresponding minima
answers.b: It is the path connecting the reactant and products on the potential energy surface
answers.c: It is the mass weighted steepest descent path from a transition state connecting to the corresponding minima
answers.d: It is the path connecting two transition states on the potential energy surface

explanations.c: IRC is defined the mass weighted steepest distance path from the transition state connecting to the corresponding minima.

questions.question: Are IRC and minimum energy path (MEP) same?

explanations.b: IRC is defined as the minimum energy path (MEP) in  mass weighted coordinates.

questions.question: The eigenvector corresponding to which of the following defines the initial condition for IRP?

answers.a: Eigenvector corresponding to all the 3N-6 frequencies
answers.b: Eigenvector corresponding to the imaginary frequency
answers.c: Eigenvectors are not required for defining the initial condition
answers.d: Eigenvector corresponding to the largest frequency

explanations.b: The first step for an IRP is taken along the eigenvector corresponding to the imaginary frequency.

answers.b: Taking an inverse of the force constant matrix followed by diagonalization
answers.c: Linear combination of cartesian coordinates of the atoms

explanations.a: The hessian matrix is diagonalized to obtain the set of eigenvectors.
